node.title: Government nearly loses vote on federal ICAC debate, is saved by COVID technicality
node.description: The Coalition manages to stop a crossbench attempt to bring on debate about a national anti-corruption commission, after government MP Bridget Archer crosses the floor.
node.content:
["The Coalition has narrowly avoided embarrassment in parliament, managing to stop a crossbench attempt to bring on debate about a national anti-corruption commission.", "Independent MP Helen Haines tried to interrupt the usual business to force a debate on her federal integrity commission bill, arguing the Coalition had been dragging its feet for three years and had not introduced its own model.", "Tasmanian Liberal MP Bridget Archer broke away from the government and backed Dr Haines' motion, which was supported by Labor and other crossbenchers.", "The vote resulted in a vote of 66 MPs for the motion\u00a0and 64 against \u2014 but a COVID-19 technicality meant the motion did not pass.", "It needed an absolute majority \u2014 or 76 votes\u00a0\u2014 to get through, but with a number of MPs not in parliament because of COVID restrictions, that was\u00a0a larger task than usual.", "After a number of minutes working out whether the government had in fact\u00a0lost the vote, independent MP Bob Katter said what many MPs were thinking: \"Clearly, a lot of us are very confused.\"", "It took a few minutes more and another vote to confirm that, despite having more votes, Dr Haines's motion was not successful.", "", "
Independent MP Helen Haines was trying to interrupt proceedings to start a debate on her federal ICAC bill.\u00a0(ABC News: Tamara Penniket)
", "Before the vote Ms Archer had risen to second Dr Haines's motion, saying\u00a0it was a difficult decision to break away from government ranks to bring on the debate.", "\"Everyone in this House, I think without exception, thinks that we need a robust federal integrity commission, that people should have trust and confidence in us, in the people that they elect, the people they send here,\" she said.", "\"The problem is that the politics has wrapped it up so tight that we're not progressing.", "Also before the vote, Dr Haines said her bill had been described as \"gold standard\".", "\"These are not my words, they are the words of the finest legal minds in the nation, from former justices of the High Court to leading academics,\" she said.", "\"They all support the passage of this bill right now.\u00a0", "\"This is a bill of the people,\u00a0from the people.\"", "", "
Dr Haines and Ms Archer walked out of the chamber together after the vote.(ABC News: Tamara Penniket)
", "South Australian crossbencher Rebekha Sharkie challenged other members of the Coalition to join Ms Archer.", "\"I would urge government members, if you too have the courage of the Member for Bass, and many of you have said quietly and privately to many of us on the crossbench that you do, why don't you put your action where your words are?\" she said.", "\"Come and sit on the right side of history.\"", "The government also narrowly defeated a similar attempt in the Senate earlier this week, when Greens and Labor tried to kickstart debate on a national integrity commission.", "The Coalition announced in 2018 its\u00a0plan to introduce an integrity commission, but it has not introduced the\u00a0proposal to parliament.", "Its model has been sharply criticised by senior lawyers as \"having no teeth\"."]
